alert.note: Alert for Guadalupe (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 6:40AM CST until January 28 at 1:31PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Comal and Guadalupe. * WHEN...Until 945 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Braunfels, Schertz, Seguin, Cibolo, McQueeney, Marion, Santa Clara, New Berlin, Geronimo, Zuehl, Nolte, Zipp, New Braunfels National Airport, Freiheit and Solms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
